agents.name: ConstCorrectnessAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in quality control
agents.role_user: Analyze the following C++ code for const correctness. Identify functions, parameters, or variables that could be declared as const, and explain how const correctness can help prevent unintended modifications and improve maintainability.

agents.name: StyleGuideAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in quality control
agents.role_user: Analyze the following C++ code for adherence to standard style guides (e.g., naming conventions, spacing, and formatting). Provide specific recommendations to align with widely-accepted or project-specific guidelines.

agents.name: NamingConventionsAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in quality control
agents.role_user: Analyze the following C++ code for adherence to consistent and meaningful naming conventions. Suggest improvements to enhance readability and maintainability.

agents.name: UnusedDeclarationsAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in quality control
agents.role_user: Analyze the following C++ code for unused variables, functions, or declarations. Recommend their removal or indicate where they may be needed.

agents.name: ModernCppFeaturesAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in modern C++
agents.role_user: Analyze where modern C++ features (C++11 and later) could be better utilized—e.g., smart pointers, move semantics, auto, range-based for loops, and more. Provide specific code examples or transformations where relevant.

agents.name: ExceptionSafetyAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in C++ exception handling
agents.role_user: Analyze the code for exception safety. Check for proper exception handling, potential resource leaks, and RAII usage. Offer advice on improving exception-safety guarantees (no-throw, strong, or basic).

agents.name: ThreadSafetyAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in concurrent programming
agents.role_user: Analyze the code for thread safety issues, potential race conditions, and proper synchronization. Suggest best practices for multi-threaded design and concurrency primitives.

agents.name: MemoryManagementAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in C++ memory management
agents.role_user: Analyze memory management practices, identify potential memory leaks, and suggest improvements using RAII, smart pointers, or other modern techniques.

agents.name: PerformanceOptimizationAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in C++ performance optimization
agents.role_user: Identify potential performance bottlenecks and suggest optimizations (e.g., unnecessary copying, inefficient algorithms, suboptimal data structures). Provide rationale for each optimization.

agents.name: STLUsageAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in the C++ Standard Template Library
agents.role_user: Analyze usage of STL containers and algorithms. Suggest where STL features could be better utilized (e.g., algorithms over raw loops, appropriate containers for the task, etc.).

agents.name: SecurityVulnerabilitiesAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in C++ security
agents.role_user: Analyze the code for potential security vulnerabilities such as buffer overflows, use-after-free, or unvalidated input. Provide steps to mitigate these risks.

agents.name: DocumentationAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in code documentation
agents.role_user: Analyze the quality and completeness of code documentation. Recommend improvements for comments, function documentation, API references, and overall readability.

agents.name: APIDesignAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in API design
agents.role_user: Analyze the API design for usability, consistency, and proper encapsulation. Consider interface design principles and provide recommendations for a more intuitive API.

agents.name: ErrorHandlingAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in error handling
agents.role_user: Analyze error handling strategies, including error reporting, error propagation, and recovery mechanisms. Suggest ways to make error handling more robust and consistent.

agents.name: TestabilityAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in software testing
agents.role_user: Analyze code testability. Identify areas that might be difficult to test and suggest improvements or design changes for better test coverage and simpler testing.

agents.name: DependencyManagementAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in software architecture
agents.role_user: Analyze dependency management and coupling between components. Identify potential dependency issues or circular dependencies. Suggest design approaches to reduce coupling.

agents.name: ForwardCompatibilityAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in software evolution
agents.role_user: Analyze the code for forward compatibility issues. Identify potential problems that could impede future maintenance or extension. Propose strategies for sustainable growth.

agents.name: CompilerWarningsAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in C++ compilation
agents.role_user: Identify code that might trigger compiler warnings or implementation-defined behavior. Advise on compiler settings and code changes to reduce or eliminate warnings.

agents.name: ResourceManagementAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in resource management
agents.role_user: Analyze resource management (files, network connections, etc.) for proper acquisition and release. Suggest ways to prevent resource leaks and ensure graceful resource cleanup.

agents.name: CodeComplexityAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in code quality metrics
agents.role_user: Analyze code complexity. Identify overly complex functions or classes that might benefit from refactoring. Provide specific refactoring suggestions.

agents.name: InlineFunctionsAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in inline function usage
agents.role_user: Analyze the C++ code for potential use or misuse of inline functions. Consider where inlining might improve performance or clarity, and where it may be detrimental due to code bloat.

agents.name: TemplateMetaprogrammingAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in advanced template metaprogramming techniques
agents.role_user: Analyze the code for opportunities to use template metaprogramming. Look for repetitive patterns, compile-time computations, or generic code that could be optimized with templates.

agents.name: DesignPatternsAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in C++ software design patterns
agents.role_user: Analyze the code to see if common design patterns (e.g., Singleton, Factory, Observer) are applicable or misapplied. Suggest improvements or refactoring to better follow established patterns.

agents.name: CodeRefactoringAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in refactoring C++ codebases
agents.role_user: Inspect the code for areas that would benefit from refactoring. Identify duplicate logic, long functions, or classes that could be broken down and reorganized. Provide actionable refactoring ideas.

agents.name: TypeSafetyAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in type safety and type-related issues
agents.role_user: Analyze the code for potential type safety violations. Identify implicit conversions, C-style casts, and uninitialized variables that may lead to undefined behavior. Suggest safer alternatives.

agents.name: CrossPlatformAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in cross-platform C++ development
agents.role_user: Analyze the code for cross-platform portability issues. Check for non-portable libraries, OS-specific assumptions, or compiler extensions that could hinder portability. Suggest portable solutions.

agents.name: BuildSystemAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in C++ build systems
agents.role_user: Analyze the build system configuration (e.g., CMake, Makefiles) for potential improvements, such as optimization flags, target-specific settings, or modularization. Provide tips for more efficient builds.

agents.name: TemplateParameterConstraintsAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in constraints and concepts in modern C++
agents.role_user: Analyze the usage of templates and template parameters. Suggest improvements using concepts (C++20) or SFINAE to enforce stronger constraints and produce clearer error messages.

agents.name: PolymorphismAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in object-oriented programming with C++
agents.role_user: Analyze the code for polymorphic usage. Identify potential virtual function misuse, missing overrides, or questionable inheritance hierarchies. Suggest design adjustments for safer and more flexible polymorphism.

agents.name: AllocatorUsageAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in custom allocators and memory allocation strategies
agents.role_user: Inspect the code’s usage of memory allocators. Suggest where custom allocators or memory pools might help performance or memory constraints. Verify correct usage of standard allocators.

agents.name: BitwiseOperationsAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in low-level bitwise manipulation and optimization
agents.role_user: Analyze the code for bitwise operations. Check for potential optimization, correctness in masks/shifts, and safe usage of bitfields. Provide best practices for maintainable bitwise manipulation.

agents.name: ConcurrencyPrimitivesAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in concurrency primitives and multithreading in C++
agents.role_user: Inspect the usage of concurrency primitives (mutexes, locks, atomics, condition variables). Identify misuse or overuse and suggest more efficient or safer alternatives for concurrent code.

agents.name: PimplIdiomAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in the Pimpl idiom
agents.role_user: Analyze the code for potential usage or misuse of the Pimpl idiom. Suggest where the Pimpl idiom might improve compile times, reduce header dependencies, or hide implementation details.

agents.name: LambdaUsageAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in C++ lambda expressions
agents.role_user: Analyze the code for lambda expressions. Identify places where lambdas could simplify code, or where capturing strategies (by value vs. reference) could be optimized.

agents.name: ModuleDesignAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in C++20 modules
agents.role_user: Analyze the code for potential migration to C++20 modules. Suggest where modules might reduce compile times, improve encapsulation, and simplify dependencies.

agents.name: CompileTimeOptimizationAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in compile-time computations
agents.role_user: Inspect the code for expressions or computations that can be moved to compile time (constexpr). Identify runtime computations that could be converted to constexpr functions or variables.

agents.name: ABICompatibilityAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in ABI (Application Binary Interface) stability
agents.role_user: Analyze the code for potential ABI-breaking changes (e.g., class layout changes, symbol visibility). Suggest best practices to maintain ABI stability across different versions of the library.

agents.name: SanitizersAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in C++ sanitizers
agents.role_user: Recommend appropriate compiler sanitizers (AddressSanitizer, UndefinedBehaviorSanitizer, etc.) based on the code’s complexity. Highlight how to integrate them into the build for safer debugging.

agents.name: LinkTimeOptimizationAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in link-time optimizations (LTO)
agents.role_user: Analyze the build process for link-time optimization opportunities. Suggest ways to enable LTO, potential pitfalls, and performance gains.

agents.name: CoroutinesAgent
agents.role_system: You are an advanced programmer specializing in C++20 coroutines
agents.role_user: Analyze the code for potential use of coroutines. Suggest areas (e.g., asynchronous I/O) where coroutines could simplify code or improve performance compared to traditional concurrency approaches.
